ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: I would recommend History 700 as a great class to take for a better understanding of the historiography of the United States. This class is also a great opportunity to engage with Yale faculty members from a variety of subjects. This class taught me how to write effective book reviews, and I now know about subjects like American economic history which I would otherwise not be as familiar with.
A valuable course to take to introduce yourself to the US history department.

I would recommend the course to another student. It provided an introduction to the historiography of the different subdisciplines of American history and so offered a platform for further study of particular areas of interest within these. It was also a good means to hear the facultys views on theprofession and their particular inspirations and intentions for their work.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: This class offers homework and discussions on a variety of subjects, so while each week may not pertain specifically to my future dissertation or research, I believe it is important to take a historiography class to gain a better understanding of the different approaches to analyzing history. I'm really glad I was able to take a class like this my first semester of graduate school.

The course immeasurably increased my knowledge of American history, and although this will not become an area of research, the courses focus on the historiographies of different subdisciplines provided me with many useful comparisons to my own research interests.
